business.headline: Paytm partners with Perplexity for AI-powered search feature on appPaytm says this move is to keep up with growing digital demand. The AI search will work in local languages, making it easier for people to use.
Explained: Why UltraTech Cement shares fell 6% todayUltraTech Cement Ltd shares fell 6%. The stock opened at Rs 10,796.15 after having closed at Rs 10,968.45 in the previous session.
Why RBI Bank, Bandhan Bank, AU Small Finance Bank shares are rising today? Shares of RBL Bank, Bandhan Bank, AU Small Finance Bank, IDFC First Bank, and IndusInd Bank gained up to 7%.

Do you have multiple UANs? Here's how to merge them Every time you join a new company, give your employer the existing UAN so they don't create another. If they've already made a new one, you need to merge it with your old one.

5 PSU banks may see government stake sale of up to 20%: ReportThe government is working on a plan in consultation with the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), the Department of Financial Services (DFS), and state-run banks.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as banking and financial stocks gain in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 115.61 points to 74,717.73, while the NSE Nifty50 added37.30 points to 22,584.85 as of 9:20 AM.

Stock market today: Top 3 stocks that could deliver good return in near term Since peaking at an all-time high in September last year, Dalal Street has seen nearly a 12% correction, leading investors to search for stocks that could offer gains despite market uncertainty.

Best place to invest: Why is World Bank bullish on India despite FII sell-off?World Bank Country Director Auguste Tano Kouame, while speaking at the Advantage Assam 2.0 Business Summit, dismissed concerns over the recent market downturn and reaffirmed confidence in India's growth.

100 crore Indians have no extra money to spend: ReportA report by a venture capital firm, Blume Ventures, says India's 'consuming class' comprises roughly 140 million people. But about 1 billion (100 crore) Indians do not have the kind of incomes to be able to spend anything on discretionary good.

Government plans Universal Pension Scheme: Who will benefit?The ministry of labour and employment is working on the proposed plan, which is expected to bring existing pension schemes under one framework.

Explained: Why European Union wants India to cut tariffs on cars, wineApart from trade, the EU also sees India as an important security partner, given rising cyber threats and tensions in regions like the South China Sea and the Indo-Pacific.
Azad Engineering launches Rs 700 crore QIP: All you need to knowThe company's board approved the opening of the issue on February 25 for the QIP of equity shares with a face value of Rs 2 each.

Volkswagen only carmaker to wrongly classify car imports: Tax authoritiesIndia says Volkswagen used a clandestine scheme to import auto parts in separate shipments, to evade detection and cut taxes, instead of declaring items as "completely knocked down", or CKD, units that face higher taxes of 30% to 35%.
Gold, stocks, or property: Which investment can make you richer?More people are turning to stocks, gold, and real estate to grow their wealth, but choosing the right one can be tricky.

Capgemini CEO on ideal workweek: Not 90, not 70, not even 50 hoursCapgemini India's CEO, Ashwin Yardi, has introduced a different perspective, one that supports a more balanced approach in the debate about work-life balance and working hours in a week.

Defence stocks like BEL, HAL are in a slump. Is it an opportunity to buy? Even after the drop, analysts remain bullish about defence stocks. In the case of BEL, 24 out of 27 analysts have a 'buy' rating on the stock. Most analysts also remain positive about HAL's stock.

Tesla shares tumble nearly 9%, market value dips below $1 trillion. Here's whyTesla share price: The decline followed data from the European Automobile Manufacturers Association, which reported Tesla's sales in Europe fell 45% in January.

Tata Motors shares down 44% from 52-week high. Should you buy the dip?Tata Motors shares: In the previous trading session, the stock closed lower 1.2% lower at Rs 660.30. So far this year, it's lost over 11%. In six months, it's down 40%. Over a year, it's fallen 30%.

RBI eases lending rules for small borrowers and NBFCs. Here's what it meansThe RBI has also put on hold its earlier proposals to increase the capital that banks must set aside for new project loans and the liquidity they need to maintain for digital deposits.

New India Co-op Bank vault had 12 times its capacity on paper: Report The Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) is probing an alleged Rs 122-crore embezzlement at the bank and has arrested three people so far, including two former senior executives of the lender.

Infosys employees get 5-8% salary hikes, lower than before: ReportThe IT firm sent salary revision letters to employees, offering hikes between 5% and 8% for most, depending on their performance rating.
Failed to deposit TDS? Tax officials may be knocking soonAround 40,000 taxpayers are under scrutiny for potential defaults in tax deductions for the financial years 2022-23 and 2023-24.

Applying for personal loan? 5 hidden charges you must check While banks may not disclose the hidden charges when applying for personal loans, borrowers must understand them when applying for the same.
FD rates dip: Check IndusInd, DCB, City Union and other top banksWith a drop in FD interest rates, depositors might witness a marginal decline in their earnings on fixed deposits.

Chairman says allegations are false: Jubilant FoodWorks after reports of FIRIn a stock exchange filing, Jubilant FoodWorks said its Chairman Shyam Sundar Bhartia has denied all allegations against him, calling them "baseless, false and disparaging, and made with clear malafide intent".

Sensex gains, Nifty loses: Markets stay range-bound as cautious sentiment prevailsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 147.71 points to close at 74,602.12, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.80 points to end at 22,547.55.

RBI withdrawal relief for New India Co-op Bank depositors. Check details hereThis announcement comes just over a week after the central bank prohibited the bank from issuing new loans, dissolved its board and took control owing to 'supervisory concerns.'

Sell India, Buy China: Why FIIs are falling out of love with Dalal StreetDalal Street has witnessed correction over the past six months, with the Nifty50 plummeting from 25,200 levels to around 22,500 levels by the end of February 2025.

Reliance bets big on Assam, to invest Rs 50,000 crore in next 5 yearsManaging Director Mukesh Ambani announced an investment of Rs 50,000 crore in Assam. A major part of Reliance's investment will be directed towards making Assam a leader in technology and artificial intelligence (AI).
Hungary announces tax exemption for mothers with 2 or more children The said announcement comes ahead of the 2026 elections and is a part of Orban's efforts to boost the country's birth rate.

DBS set to cut 4,000 jobs over 3 years due to AI, says CEODBS CEO Piyush Gupta said the bank will shrink its workforce by 10% in the next three years due to artificial intelligence replacing human roles.

Hein Schumacher to step down as Unilever CEO in MarchThe departure comes just weeks after Unilever announced underwhelming full-year earnings and chose Amsterdam over London and New York as the primary listing for its ice cream business.
Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 10% todayAt around 12:56 pm, shares of the non-banking financial company were up 7.65% to Rs 6,195.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

What is Universal Pension Scheme? Here's all you need to know With India's senior citizen population aged 60 years and above expected to touch 227 million by 2036, a comprehensive social security or pension scheme is necessary.

Adani Group commits to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Assam. Details hereThe investment will focus on infrastructure projects aimed at transforming Assam into a major economic hub. Funds will be allocated to sectors such as airports, aero cities, city gas distribution, transmission networks, cement production, and road projects, with the goal of enhancing connectivity and industrial capacity.

New Tax Regime: Income up to Rs 13.7 lakh can be tax-free. Here's howFollowing the Union Budget 2025, annual income up to Rs 12 lakh became tax-free. But there's a way to push it even further to Rs 13.7 lakh.

Sebi proposes tighter rules for index derivatives. Here's what it meansIn a consultation paper released late Monday, Sebi said it wants to link stock derivative position limits to the cash market. The idea is to cap the market-wide position limit at the lower of 15% of a stock's free-float market cap or 60 times its average daily delivery value.

Dalal Street holiday: Is the stock market open or close on Maha Shivratri 2025?Stock markets usually operate from Monday to Friday, except on declared holidays. They remain closed on Saturdays and Sundays.

Tata Capital IPO to soon make Dalal Street debut as board clears listing plansTata Capital will be the first company from the Tata Group to launch an IPO since Tata Technologies went public in November 2023.

Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak to open higher, but FII selling remains concernThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 81.16 points to 74,535.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 11.40 points to 22,564.75 as of 9:25 AM.

entertainment.headline: O Saathi Re: Imtiaz Ali's Netflix series is a modern story with a vintage heartNetflix has released the first look of its new series O Saathi Re, starring Avinash Tiwary, Aditi Rao Hydari, and Arjun Rampal. The series, directed by Arif Ali, will be an 'ode to vintage love in modern times'.

Prajakta Koli hilariously dances to 'Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar…' at sangeet. WatchPrajakta Koli danced to Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar Nahin Karte at her sangeet, leaving guests in splits. She married Vrishank Khanal in Karjat on February 25.

Vijay Yesudas reacts to fake news about father Yesudas's hospitalisationReports were rife that playback singer Yesudas was hospitalised in Chennai due to age-related illness. His son and playback singer Vijay Yesudas exclusively spoke to India Today and shut down the rumours.

Sex Education actor Alexander Westwood jailed for 15 years for sex offencesSex Education actor Alexander Westwood received a 15-year prison sentence for multiple sex offenses. The case has captured widespread media attention due to Westwood's role in the popular Netflix show.

Aashram 3 Part 1 ending explained: Will Pammi's revenge end Baba Nirala's reign?With Aashram Season 3 Part 2 releasing on February 27, let us take a look at how the season ended on a cliffhanger with Baba Nirala's misuse of power and a change in dynamics.

Amit Trivedi says Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay was 'unfortunate'Amit Trivedi, in an interview with India Today Digital, discussed the controversy over Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay's India tour and whether it would impact on the image of Indian artists.

Rapper Kanye West trying to save marriage with Bianca Censori: ReportKanye West is reportedly trying to prevent his marriage with Bianca Censori from ending. An insider reveals that Bianca is considering divorce, and Kanye is panicking.

Singer Palash Sen on working with Akshay Kumar, not being 'accepted' by BollywoodEuphoria's lead vocalist Palash Sen spoke to India Today Digital about collaborating with Bollywood star Akshay Kumar on the song Mahakal Chalo, work opportunities in the Hindi film industry, and more in an exclusive interaction.

Actors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalwani to separate after 9 years of marriageActors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalvani are separating after nine-years of marriage. Amid growing speculation, Aman has addressed the rumours about their relationship.

Baalveer actor Dev Joshi marries girlfriend Aarti, first pics outBaalveer actor Dev Joshi married his girlfriend Aarti in a beautiful ceremony. The wedding festivities, including haldi and mehndi, were spectacular and captured in stunning photos.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan, Inayat Verma series to stream in MarchThe streaming date of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma-starrer Be Happy is out. It promises to be a touching film about a single father's journey to support his daughter's dream of performing on a dance reality show.

A Man on the Inside: Ted Danson's charming comedy deserves more loveA Man on the Inside is a warm and witty series which tackles multiple subjects, including loss, new beginnings and, well, crime. The Ted Danson-starrer is currently streaming on Netflix.

Shreya Ghoshal on Chikni Chameli: Embarrassed when 5-year-old girls sing itShreya Ghoshal says she feels embarrassed when young girls sing Chikni Chameli, stressing that lyrics should be written more thoughtfully, as music and films have a deep impact on society.

Hina Khan updates fans about cancer treatment: My chemo and surgery are overHina Khan recently gave an update about her cancer treatment. The actor mentioned that her chemotherapy and surgery are over.

Tanmay Bhat jokes about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his textsTanmay Bhat hilariously addressed the India's Got Latent controversy, joking about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his texts. The reaction video left fellow comedians laughing and also "triggered" them.

Singer Udit Narayan visits Maha Kumbh Mela with wife, expresses gratitude Singer Udit Narayan was among the latest celebrities to visit the holy city of Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh 2025. In an interview with ANI, he expressed his gratitude and congratulated Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for the well-organised and efficient arrangements.

My Dearest Nemesis review: Chaotic chemistry makes even familiar trope workMy Dearest Nemesis features K-drama stars Moon Ga young and Choi Hyun-wook in the lead. It is available to stream on Viki. Here's our take on the romantic drama.

Internet calls Farah Khan 'insensitive' for mocking Gaurav Khanna's colour blindnessCelebrity MasterChef judge Farah Khan mocked TV actor Gaurav Khanna's colour blindness on the show. Following the same, the internet is outraged by her comments, criticising the filmmaker and calling her 'insensitive'.

Parineeti Chopra gears up for her first Netflix yet-to-be-titled thriller seriesActor Parineeti Chopra is set to make her series OTT debut with a Netflix project. The actor shared a post and informed about sharing screen space with Nimrit Kaur, Soni Razdan, and others.

Tanmay Bhat's X account hacked, comedian warns followersTanmay Bhat's X account recently got hacked, leading to fraudulent messages being posted online. The comedian shared a post on his Instagram and warned his followers.

Prajakta Koli-Vrishank Khanal can't take their eyes off each other in haldi picsActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry longtime boyfriend Vrishank Khanan on February 25. Ahead of the grand day, the actor shared pictures from her haldi function.

Anupam Mittal on India's Got Latent backlash: Not a lost episode of Satyamev JayateAnupam Mittal weighs in on the India's Got Latent row, arguing that YouTube should also be held accountable. He calls Big Tech the real culprit, criticising digital platforms for fueling outrage-driven content.

Bobby Deol says Aashram helped him break industry image, explore new rolesActor Bobby Deol is all set to return as Baba Nirala in Prakash Jha's series, Aashram 3 part 2. The actor confessed that he wanted to step out of his comfort zone.

Waking of Nation trailer: Taaruk Raina fights to prove Jallianwala Bagh was plannedA new show that explores the events surrounding the Jallianwala Bagh massacre is set to premiere on Sony LIV on March 8. Starring Taaruk Raina in the lead role, the series is titled The Waking of a Nation.
Singer Justin Bieber responds to rumours of drug useJustin Bieber's representative has reacted to the reports of the singer's drug use and called them false.

Ranveer Allahbadia runs to car after recording statement in Latent probeRanveer Allahbadia was clicked in a hurried state, running towards his car as the paparazzi tried to capture his pictures on Monday. The YouTuber visited the Maharashtra Cyber office in Mahape after recording his statement.

Kaushaljis vs Kaushal review: A simple yet complex tale of second chance in loveReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Kaushaljis vs Kaushal movie review: This film is a heartfelt exploration of second chances in love, focusing on a middle-aged couple navigating the complexities of separation and familial expectations. Set in the relatable backdrop of Kannauj, the film captivates with its simplicity and stellar performances.

Dupahiya trailer: A wedding, a missing bike and a lot of chaos in offingThe first full trailer of Prime Video's upcoming comedy series, Dupahiya, is here. The show will feature actors such as Sparsh Shrivastava and Gajraj Rao in pivotal roles.

Bride-to-Be Prajakta Koli dances to Zingaat with fiance at mehndi ceremony. WatchPrajakta Koli shared glimpses of her mehndi ceremony as she danced joyfully with fiance Vrishank Khanal. The couple is set to marry on February 25.

Zero Day review: Star power can't save this weakly executed political dramaReleased-Thu Feb 20, 2025Zero Day, directed by Lesli Linka Glatter, is a political drama featuring a stellar cast including Robert De Niro and Angela Bassett. While the performances are strong, the series struggles with plot depth and resolution.

Watch: Jennie and Doechii bring the heat with ExtraL ahead of RubyJennie and Doechii are making waves with their latest collaboration, ExtraL. As Jennie gears up for her solo debut with the album Ruby, fans can expect a bold new chapter in her musical journey.

Complaint against Munawar Faruqui for 'insulting religion' on Hafta Vasooli showComedian Munawar Faruqui landed in legal trouble after a complaint was filed against him for hurting religious sentiments through his show, Hafta Vasooli. The advocate shared a copy of the complaint on X.

'Mismatched' actor Prajakta Koli shares dreamy pics from her mehndiContent creator and actor Prajakta Koli has started her pre-wedding celebrations with a vibrant mehndi ceremony. She shared joyful moments with her fiance Vrishank Khanal and family on social media.

Honey Singh's Millionaire concert in Mumbai showed what grand comebacks look likeYo Yo Honey Singh made a powerful return to the stage in Mumbai, captivating fans with his energy and heartfelt messages. His performance was a testament to his resilience and dedication to the art.

Samay Raina recalls what he asked Tanmay Bhat after India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina addresses the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remark on his show, India's Got Latent, during his tour in Canada. He recalled what he had asked Tanmay Bhat after the controversy erupted.
Honey Singh's jibe at Raftaar, Badshah: People say they'll write my destinyHoney Singh took a direct dig at fellow artists Badshah and Raftaar at the first Millionaire India Tour stop in Mumbai.

Watch: Honey Singh's take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi Aa Gaya Oye'Honey Singh launched his Millionaire India Tour in Mumbai, delivering a captivating performance that engaged a sold-out audience. He shared his take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi aa gays oye', emphasising unity among diverse Indian communities.

Watch: Honey Singh kicks off Millionaire tour with a grand Mumbai showRapper Honey Singh launched his Millionaire Tour with a spectacular concert in Mumbai. The show featured dramatic entrances and a lineup of energetic performances.

Undercover High School X review: Fans give thumbs up to Seo Kang-joon's K-dramaUndercover High School, featuring Seo Kang-joon and Jin Ki-joo, has premiered on MBC TV. The series, praised for its engaging storyline, follows an undercover NIS agent as a high school student.

Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege. Ricco had once defended Osama bin Laden.

general news.headline: Suspended AAP MLAs blocked from Delhi Assembly in new showdown with BJPAAP leaders claimed they were blocked from entering the Delhi Assembly on Thursday, alleging barricades were placed on the entry road to stop them.

US firms can now hire Indian graduates under 'gold card' citizenship plan: TrumpUS President Donald Trump announced that American companies can now hire Indian graduates from US universities under the new 'gold card' citizenship plan. Trump emphasised that the current system has forced top Indian talent to leave the US, missing key opportunities.

Out on bail, Pune rape accused used mask to hide identity, manhunt to arrest himA history-sheeter out on bail since 2019 allegedly raped a 26-year-old woman inside a stationary state transport bus at the busy Swargate bus station in Pune.

Afghanistan winning is no shock: Cricket's elite have ambitious new rivalsAfghanistan's latest victory over England in the Champions Trophy 2025 reaffirms their place amongst cricket's elite, proving their success is no longer an underdog story. Overcoming war, instability, and infrastructural challenges, the Afghan men's team has written its success story in 2X speed.
What is mono diet, and is it even practical?The mono diet may seem like a quick fix for your weight loss woes, but it might not be as sustainable or practical as it appears.
PM Modi reflects on Maha Kumbh: 'It wasn't easy, forgive me if…'PM Modi penned his thoughts on 45-day-long Maha Kumbh mela as the grand event concluded on Wednesday.

Maharashtra woman battles for life in US after road accident, family seeks visaAs a result of the accident on February 14, Neelam Shinde suffered serious injuries to her head, hands, legs and chest. She also had to undergo immediate surgery and is currently in critical condition.

IIT Ranchi doesn't exist: Centre fact-checks Sam Pitroda's hacking claimsSam Pitroda had alleged that an event he was addressing at IIT Ranchi was disrupted when someone hacked into the system and played obscene content.

New Jeffrey Epstein files with 'lot of information' to be released today The US Justice Department plans to release flight logs and numerous names linked to Jeffrey Epstein on Thursday, Attorney General Pam Bondi said. She added that efforts are underway to protect the personal details of over 250 victims. Epstein died in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges.

Bajrang Dal's 'love jihad' tableau on Maha Shivratri sparks row in BiharOne of the tableaux depicted alleged atrocities committed by Muslims against Hindu girls and included a refrigerator with dolls representing chopped-up women, visually suggesting a girl's body cut into pieces.

Guru Randhawa supports government's move to make Punjabi mandatory in schoolsSinger Guru Randhawa on Thursday shared a post on X supporting the Punjab government's decision to make Punjabi mandatory in schools irrespective of which board they are affiliated to.

Elon Musk admits DOGE accidentally cut Ebola prevention aid: We won't be perfectElon Musk, wearing a black 'Make America Great Again' cap and a t-shirt that said "tech support", made the admission while addressing US President Donald Trump's first cabinet meeting on Wednesday at the White House.

Will Smith nearly locks lips with singer India at event, fans call it 'cringe' Actor Will Smith recently surprised fans with his steamy performance alongside singer India Martinez at Miami's Premio Lo Nuestro awards. The two nearly shared a kiss onstage, leaving the audience in shock.

The Musk melon in India-US bonhomie bowlThe Tesla CEO and Trump's close associate eyes the Indian market for his cars, but the road won't be smooth for either his EVs or satellite internet service Starlink

Union Cabinet approves Waqf bill based on parliamentary panel report: Sources The report of the Joint Parliamentary Committee on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 was tabled in both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on February 13 amid massive uproar by the Opposition.

India blasts Pak at UN over Kashmir remarks: In no position to lectureIndian diplomats at the Geneva meeting asserted that instead of its "unhealthy obsession" with India, Pakistan should focus on providing actual governance and justice to its own people.

Blake Lively mourns Michelle Trachtenberg's death: She was fiercely loyalBlake Lively mourned Gossip Girl co-star Michelle Trachtenberg's sudden death at 39, calling her "electric" and "fiercely loyal." Chace Crawford, Kim Cattrall, and others also paid tribute.

Punjabi must to pass Class 10: State government's strict order after CBSE draftThe Punjab government has made Punjabi mandatory for Class 10, requiring all schools to teach it as a primary subject. Schools failing to comply will face action under the Punjab Learning of Punjabi and Other Languages Act, 2008.
Athena to land near Moon's South Pole, deploy a hopping roverAthena, a 15-foot (4.7-meter) lander, will touch down approximately 160 kilometers from the Moon's south pole.

Jeff Bezos resets WaPo Opinion page, editor quitsIn a post on X, Jeff Bezos clarified that while The Washington Post would continue to explore a variety of topics, perspectives opposing these core values would no longer find a place in its opinion pages.

100 crore Indians have no extra money to spend: ReportA report by a venture capital firm, Blume Ventures, says India's 'consuming class' comprises roughly 140 million people. But about 1 billion (100 crore) Indians do not have the kind of incomes to be able to spend anything on discretionary good.

Delhi receives light rain, records season's highest minimum temperatureOn Tuesday, the maximum temperature in Delhi soared to 32 degrees Celsius, six notches above the seasonal average. The last time the city recorded such a high February temperature was on February 22, 2006.

Let's see how it goes: Shashi Tharoor to attend Congress meet of Kerala leadersAmid speculation about his political future and reports of internal dissent, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor will attend a crucial party meeting in Delhi to discuss Kerala politics and 2026 Assembly elections.

Students clash at university in Delhi over non-veg food on Maha ShivratriThe Students' Federation of India (SFI) and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) accused each other of inciting violence at Delhi's South Asian University.

Shilpa Shetty, Rani Mukerji, Urmila, celebs at Anil Kapoor's house on Mahashivratri Shilpa Shetty, Rani Mukerji and Urmila Mantondkar, among other celebrities, visited Anil Kapoor's house on Mahashivratri for a special puja. Several pictures from the occasion have emerged online.

Sonakshi Sinha on her marriage with Zaheer Iqbal: Never discussed religionActor Sonakshi Sinha recently opened up about her interfaith marriage with Zaheer Iqbal. The couple got married last year in June.

Matthew Perry's documentary shows actor given 27 Ketamine shots leading to deathActor Matthew Perry, who died in October 2023, was allegedly given 27 ketamine doses in the last three days prior to his death. A new documentary based on the FRIENDS star's life has a prosecutor claiming that Dr Plasencia got an untrained assistant to administer high doses to the actor.

Pooja Hegde to set the dance floors on fire in Rajinikanth's Coolie. New poster outPooja Hegde has been roped in to do a dance number in Rajinikanth's Coolie. According to reports, she has completed shooting her portions for the film.

sports.headline: Got to work out if I am part of the problem or solution for England: Jos ButtlerEngland captain Jos Buttler has admitted that he needs to work out if he is part of the problem or solution for England after their Champions Trophy 2025 exit. England have been going through a rough patch in white-ball cricket, with the loss to Afghanistan being the latest low point.

Bangladesh need to work on improving their system: Mohammed SalahudinBangladesh assistant coach emphasised the need for a structured system to improve performances, stating that past Champions Trophy defeats won't affect their mindset ahead of their final group-stage clash against Pakistan. The focus remains on learning and executing a stronger game plan.

PAK vs BAN Rawalpindi weather forecast: Will rain wash out dead rubber?Pakistan and Bangladesh are aiming to finish off their campaign on a positive note as both teams are set to lock horns in Rawalpindi on February 27. But will weather play spoilsport on Thursday?

Ankle pain, personal views: Mitchell Starc cites Champions Trophy withdrawal reasonsAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc said that ankle pain and some personal views were the reasons behind him withdrawing from the Champions Trophy 2025 squad. Starc is one of the big names missing from the Australia squad for the ongoing tournament.

Afghanistan will never be taken lightly again: Coach Jonathan TrottAfghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott stressed that his team's thrilling win over England wasn't just about the result but about establishing Afghanistan as a side that commands respect. He reiterated their mission to ensure no opponent ever underestimates them, regardless of their stature.

Bangladesh, Pakistan look to salvage pride as rain threat looms largeChampions Trophy: Pakistan and Bangladesh will be looking to salvage some pride when they face each other, but there is a chance of rain in the penultimate Group A match.

All-round Nat Sciver-Brunt fires as Mumbai Indians hammer UP WarriorzWPL 2025: Nat Sciver-Brunt scored an unbeaten 75 and picked up three wickets as Mumbai Indians beat UP Warriorz by eight wickets on Wednesday to go to the top of the points table.

Thrilled by Afghan win, Ravi Shastri fires sharp message to England: No excusesFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri and other pundits congratulated Afghanistan following their stunning win over England in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Afghanistan beat England by eight runs to knock them out of the tournament.

England knocked out, can Afghanistan qualify for semfinals from Group B?Afghanistan beat England by eight runs in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which has kept them alive in the tournament as they're in contention to make it to the semi finals. Here's how they can reach the last four in the event.

Afghanistan knock England out of Champions Trophy in last-over thrillerChampions Trophy 2025: Afghanistan beat England by eight runs at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore to stay alive in the competition. They also knocked the Three Lions out of the competition.

Aaqib Javed gets irritated by India match questions ahead of Bangladesh fixturePakistan's head coach Aaqib Javed got irritated by questions about India vs Pakistan match during the pre-match press conference ahead of their last fixture in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Bangladesh.

Bangladesh assistant coach expects good performances from batters vs PakistanBangladesh assistant coach Muhammad Salahudin said that they will have to bat well in order to beat Pakistan in their last fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Pakistan fan shows love for Virat Kohli by printing his name and jersey number on bikeA Virat Kohli fan in Pakistan went out of his way to show his love for the India star as he printed his name and jersey number on his bike. Kohli recently scored a century against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025, which was widely celebrated across the border.

Fakhar Zaman refutes retirement rumours, wants to play Test cricketChampions Trophy 2025: Fakhar Zaman said that he has no intentions of retiring from the game, also expressing his wishes to represent Pakistan in Test cricket.

Pakistan vs Bangladesh, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingPakistan and Bangladesh are all set to lock horns in their respective last fixtures of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Thursday, February 27 in Rawalpindi. Both teams will be eager for a win, having not been able to win a single match in the tournament so far.

If Kohli scored century in Pakistan, he'd receive same love as India: Mohammad AmirFormer Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir said that Virat Kohli wouldn't have been able to differentiate between Pakistan and India, had he scored his century in Pakistan instead of Dubai. Kohli scored an unbeaten 100* (111) against Pakistan to help India win by six wickets in Champions Trophy 2025.

Danish Malewar, Karun Nair help Vidarbha recover on Day 1 Ranji Trophy 2024-25: Karun Nair and Danish Malewar helped Vidarbha finish Day 1 of the final against Kerala at 254 for four at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur. Malewar stayed not out on 138 at Stumps on the opening day.

Mohammad Amir hails 'complete package' Jasprit Bumrah as world's no 1 bowlerPakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir has hailed India's Jasprit Bumrah as the best bowler in the world for his remarkable exploits across all three formats of the game.

Pakistan fans love Virat, he is a complete package like Ronaldo: Mohammad AmirChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today from Lahore, fast bowler Mohammad Amir explained why fans in Pakistan love Virat Kohli. The India star hit a match-winning hundred against Pakistan in their Group A meeting on Sunday, February 23 in Dubai.

Rafael Nadal keeps a close eye on 15-year-old India sensation Maaya Rajeshwaran15-year-old Maaya Rajeshwaran trained hard at the Rafael Nadal Academy as Nadal kept a close eye on the Indian tennis sensation. The teenager recently hogged the headlines after advancing to the semis of the Mumbai Open.

One last time? Morse code on MS Dhoni's T-shirt sparks retirement speculationIPL 2025: MS Dhoni arrived in Chennai on Wednesday to join the Super Kings camp. A Morse code on Dhoni's T-shirt has created a stir on social media, intensifying speculation about his retirement.

Matthew Kuhnemann cleared for bowling in international cricket by ICCAustralian left-arm spinner Matthew Kuhnemman has been cleared to bowl in international cricket by the ICC after his action was reported by match officials during the second Test against Sri Lanka.

After missing WPL, Alyssa Healy out of New Zealand T20I series Alyssa Healy will miss Australia's three-match T20I series against New Zealand as she recovers from a foot injury. Australia have called up Nicole Faltum with Beth Mooney confirmed to don the wicket-keeping gloves.

Ibrahim Zadran hits first-ever Champions Trophy century for Afghanistan Champions Trophy: Ibrahim Zadran became the first Afghanistan batter to score a hundred in the history of the tournament when he achieved the feat against England on Wednesday in Lahore.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
